page.title: 02CATTLE AND GOATS ON SCORAIG
page.content: ON SCORAIG COWS ARE KEPT FOR MILKING AND SELLING CALVES.THE MILKING COW IS IMPORTANT AS IT SUPPLIES ITS OWN AND NEIGHBOURS HOUSEHOLDS WITH MILK.MANY PEOPLE MAKE THEIR OWN BUTTER AND CHEESE.BEST MILKING COWS ARE JERSEY CROSSES. BEEF COWS ARE SERVED BY A BULL HIRED FROM THE AGRICULTURE DEPT. EACH COW SHOULD PRODUCE ONE CALF A YEAR.IN AUTUMN BULL CALVES ARE DRIVEN 12 MILES TO DUNDONNELL AND TAKEN BY LORRY TO DINGWALL MARKET.HEIFER CALVES ARE SOMETIMES KEPT,SOMETIMES SOLD. IN SUMMER THERE IS PLENTY OF HILL GRAZING FOR THE CATTLE WHILE IN WINTER THEY ARE BROUGHT INTO THE CROFTS AND FED HAY,STRAW,BRUISED BARLEY AND OTHER CONCENTRATES. A FEW PEOPLE KEEP GOATS FOR THEIR MILK SUPPLY. THEY ARE CHEAPER TO KEEP BUT ARE MORE DESTRUCTIVE THAN COWS.
